intro: Seseli annuum subsp. annuum, commonly known as common seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves with a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Seseli annuum subsp. annuum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
